page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY-THE MANOR
page.content: This interesting old house is situated in Gotham's village square. It was built in 1210 and stands in four acres of ground. Beside the Manor are the stables which have been converted into a deep-freeze room. There remains a lead pump, dated 1857, which can be seen behind the house. The loft is murky and beside the door frame is a plaster wall,inscribed with numerous builders' names. The oak roof timbers originated from old sailing ships. There is a tunnel,leading to the church, which was used as an escape route by the priest. The Sheppard family have lived at the Manor since 1918,and have made various alterations during that time.
